TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TypeLibVarAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Contains the <see cref="T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.VARFLAGS"> that were originally imported for this field from the COM type library.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The [Tlbimp.exe (Type Library Importer)](../Topic/Tlbimp.exe%20\(Type%20Library%20Importer\).md) applies this attribute to fields.
This attribute is applied when a type library is imported and should never be changed. It is only applied when the method's `VARFLAGS` evaluate to non-zero. The attribute is designed to be used by tools that need to know how the original `VARFLAGS` were set. The common language runtime does not use this attribute.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to get the TypeLibVarAttribute value of a field.
[!CODE [TypeLibVar#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_CLR/TypeLibVar#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int16 flags) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.TypeLibVarFlags"> value for the attributed field as found in the type library it was imported from.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.TypeLibVarAttribute"> class with the specified <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.TypeLibVarFlags?displayProperty=fullName> value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.TypeLibVarFlags flags) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.TypeLibVarFlags"> value for the attributed field as found in the type library it was imported from.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.TypeLibVarAttribute"> class with the specified <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.TypeLibVarFlags?displayProperty=fullName> value.
Gets the <see cref="T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.TypeLibVarFlags"> value for this field.
